title: A lamentable ditty composed vpon the death of Robert Lord Devereux, late earle of Essex who was beheaded in the Tower of London, on Ashwenesday in the morning, 1600. To the tune of Welladay
publicationStmtPublisher: for Cuthbert Wright and are to be sold at his shop in little Saint Bartholmes close to the Lame-hospitall,
